methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: Auto append fbp for Polymer

methods.name: firstUpdated
methods.description: Auto append fbp for lit elements

methods.name: _FBPTriggerWire
methods.description: Triggers a wire

methods.name: _FBPTraceWires
methods.description:
Log all triggered wires for this component. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPTraceWires()`

methods.name: _FBPDebug
methods.description:
Get information for the triggered wire. This function may help you at debugging.
Select your element in the dev console and call `$0._FBPDebug('--dataReceived')`

params.name: openDebugger
params.description: opens the debugger console, so you can inspect your component.

methods.name: _appendFBP
methods.description: parses the dom for flowbased programming tags

methods.name: _FBPReady
methods.description:
Livecycle method
This method is called, when the wires are ready.
And triggers the --FBPready wire. This does *not* respect a lit updateComplete

methods.name: _pathGet
methods.description:
Reads a value from a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method returns `undefined` (will never throw.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc:
Value at path, or `undefined` if the path could not be
 fully dereferenced.

methods.name: _pathSet
methods.description:
Sets a value to a path.  If any sub-property in the path is `undefined`,
this method will no-op.

params.name: root
params.description: Object from which to dereference path from

return.desc: The normalized version of the input path

methods.name: _split
methods.description:
Splits a path into an array of property names. Accepts either arrays
of path parts or strings.

Example:

```
split(['foo.bar', 0, 'baz'])  // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
split('foo.bar.0.baz')        // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
```

elements.name: FuroLoadingIndicatorBar

elements.description:
# furo-app-bar-top
Application top bar

`furo-app-bar-top`

### Styling
The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

Custom property                                | Description | Default  | Fallback
-----------------------------------------------|-------------|----------|----------
`--furo-app-bar-top-background-light` | Light background color | --primary-light | #7f7f7f;
`--furo-app-bar-top-background-dark` |Dark background color | --primary-dark | #aFAFAF;

properties.name: _navigationIcon
properties.description: Use method open or set this attribute to open a drawer in float mode

properties.name: drawer
properties.description: drawer to connect the ƒ-show-navigation-icon="--drawerFloats" ƒ-hide-navigation-icon="--drawerPinned"

methods.name: startActivity
methods.description:
You can show a progress indicator while you have pending requests or work
Shows furo-loading-indicator-bar

methods.name: stopActivity
methods.description:
Stop loading indicator
Hides furo-loading-indicator-bar

methods.name: _FBPReady
methods.description: flow is ready lifecycle method

elements.name: FuroAppBarTop

attributes.name: drawer
attributes.description: drawer to connect the ƒ-show-navigation-icon="--drawerFloats" ƒ-hide-navigation-icon="--drawerPinned"

navigation-clicked

navigation-clicked

`furo-app-drawer`

properties.name: floatBreakpoint
properties.description: Min width of the app-drawer to switch to floating mode

properties.name: _isFloating
properties.description: Use method floatDrawer or set this attribute to enable float mode

properties.name: isReverse
properties.description: Enable this to put the drawer on the right side

properties.name: name
properties.description: name of this drawer, needed if you want to connect to this drawer

methods.name: _split
methods.description:
Splits a path into an array of property names. Accepts either arrays
of path parts or strings.

Example:

```
split(['foo.bar', 0, 'baz'])  // ['foo', 'bar', '0', 'baz']
```

methods.name: open
methods.description: open the drawer when it is in float mode

methods.name: close
methods.description: closes the drawer when it is in float mode

methods.name: floatDrawer
methods.description: let the drawer float

methods.name: pinDrawer
methods.description: disable the floating

methods.name: putDrawerToRight
methods.description:
Put the drawer on the right side

Or use the attribute reverse for the same effect

methods.name: putDrawerToLeft
methods.description: Put the drawer on the left side (default)

elements.name: FuroAppDrawer

attributes.name: float-breakpoint
attributes.description: Min width of the app-drawer to switch to floating mode

attributes.name: is-reverse
attributes.description: Enable this to put the drawer on the right side

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: name of this drawer, needed if you want to connect to this drawer

events.name: drawer-closed
events.description:
drawer-closed
Fired when drawer was closed.

events.name: drawer-opened
events.description:
drawer-opened
Fired when drawer was opened.

events.name: is-floating
events.description:
is-floating
Fired when drawer is in floating mode. This event is fired when drawer is closed and opened

events.name: is-pinned
events.description:
is-pinned
Fired when drawer is in pinned mode.
